greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest squarefree number dividing n-th central binomial coefficient C(n,[ n/2 ]).
comment: a(2k+1)=a(2k+2) unless 2k+1 is in A000225, in which case a(2k+2)=2*a(2k+1). - _Robert Israel_, Jan 21 2020
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3364
example: n=10: C(10,5)=252=2*2*3*3*7. The largest squarefree number dividing the 10th central binomial coefficient is 2*3*7=42. Thus a(10)=42
mathematica: Table[Last@ Select[Divisors@ Binomial[n, Floor[n/2]], SquareFreeQ], {n, 35}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 05 2017 *)
program: (MAGMA) [&*PrimeDivisors(Binomial(n, Floor(n/2))): n in [1..35]]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Jan 21 2020
results.author: _Labos Elemer_
